results.title: Paddington recommended
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from Chapter 6 from the book Paddington Takes the Air. While waiting to dine with the Browns at a fashionable restaurant, Paddington is mistaken for Duncan Hyde, the famous food expert. Hoping for a favourable review in his food guide, the manager offers Paddington a choice of meals on the house. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington makes a clean sweep
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Mr and Mrs Brown decide to begin spring cleaning and buy a chimney sweeping outfit. While Mr and Mrs Brown go to the sales, Paddington decides to lend a helping paw by cleaning the chimney but encounters problems when the brush becomes detached in the chimney and when he attempts to retrieve it, his head becomes stuck in the chimney pot! Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: A Bear in hot water
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington takes his first bath at the Brown’s and makes a terrible mess with soap and water. Based on a chapter of the Michael Bond story “A Bear called Paddington”.

results.title: A Visit to the hospital
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington Bear at large in a hospital fails to find Mr Curry, the patient, but gets to see a psychiatrist instead. Amusing word association games follow. Animated by Ivor Wood. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
results.description:

results.title: Paddington turns detective
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington receives a torch from Mr Gruber as a gift and receives an answer to his morse code signals from Mr. Brown’s greenhouse! He assumes the identity of Feathers Locke, Detective and proceeds to investigate, even fingerprinting Mr. Brown’s prize marrow! Adapted from Michael Bond’s book ‘More about Paddington’. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Music by Herbert Chappel.

results.title: Mr Gruber's mystery tour
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from chapter 4 from the book “Paddington marches on” by Michael Bond. Mr Gruber takes Paddington on a visit to the Wax Museum where Paddington is astonished and amazed at what he sees. Paddington has never visited the Wax Musem before. Narrated by Michael Hordern.

results.title: The Woodlanders
results.creator_credit: Phil Agland, Barney Reisz, Channel Four and Pathe Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Thomas Hardy, “The Woodlanders” is a passionate story of love. Giles Winterborne (Rufus Sewell) and Grace Melbury (Emily Woof) have had an agreement to marry since childhood. However, Grace’s return from boarding school and subsequent elevation in society cause their engagement to be called off. Silently adored by his friend, Marty, Giles continues to pine for Grace, whilst she in turn falls in love with the handsome new doctor, Fitzpiers. But as they follow their separate courses, Grace and Giles find that their lives become inextricably entwined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Agland, Barney Reisz, Channel Four and Pathe Productions

results.title: The Wonderful world of dogs
results.creator_credit: Mark Lewis, ABC-TV (Australia), Australian Film Commission, Channel 4 and Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: 540,000 dogs inhabit the city of Sydney and every one with a story to tell. This whimsical, humorous film tells some of them, and in particular, the story of Fugly, the most impounded dog in Australia, and his impact on the suburb of Mosman. Dog lovers and dog haters alike express their point of view as we watch Fugly roaming the streets. “Some dogs just want to be dogs. Some people want dogs to be people. But dogs will be dogs … and people will be people. We all live together.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Lewis, ABC-TV (Australia), Australian Film Commission, Channel 4 and Radio Pictures
